member.name: T:Toolbox.NETMF.NET.TelnetServer
member.summary: A telnet server with minimal TELNET and ANSI support
member.remarks: I found these links very useful: ANSI escapes: http://isthe.com/chongo/tech/comp/ansi_escapes.html Telnet commands: http://www.networksorcery.com/enp/protocol/telnet.htm

member.name: F:Toolbox.NETMF.NET.TelnetServer._WriteBuffer
member.summary: Some commands, like color, will be buffered to avoid small data packets. This actually speeds up the server.

member.name: M:Toolbox.NETMF.NET.TelnetServer.Listen
member.summary: Listens and waits until we have a connection

member.name: M:Toolbox.NETMF.NET.TelnetServer._Write(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.param: When true, data will be sent in front of the next packet

member.name: M:Toolbox.NETMF.NET.TelnetServer._Write(System.Char[],System.Boolean)
member.param: When true, data will be sent in front of the next packet

member.name: M:Toolbox.NETMF.NET.TelnetServer.Beep
member.summary: Sends a beep to the client

member.name: M:Toolbox.NETMF.NET.TelnetServer.Input(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Reads out input from the terminal
member.param: The amount of bytes to read, if 0, it reads until a carriage return
When set to false, it won't wait for data, it will just return empty if there's no data

member.name: M:Toolbox.NETMF.NET.TelnetServer.Print(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Prints a text to the screen
member.param: Normally a Print call will print the text and go to the next line. Set this to true to avoid that behaviour.
When true, data won't be sent immediately but stored in a buffer.

member.name: M:Toolbox.NETMF.NET.TelnetServer.Locate(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.param: When true, data won't be sent immediately but stored in a buffer.

member.name: P:Toolbox.NETMF.NET.TelnetServer.EchoEnabled
member.summary: When true, user inputted data gets echoed

member.name: P:Toolbox.NETMF.NET.TelnetServer.InputBuffer
member.summary: Returns the amount of bytes waiting for this.Input()

member.name: T:Toolbox.NETMF.NET.IRC_Client
member.remarks: This client contains the most basic features to stay connected to an IRC server. It can also reply to the CTCP commands VERSION, TIME and PING. To disable or change the CTCP replies, just create your own OnCtcpRequest method.

member.name: F:Toolbox.NETMF.NET.IRC_Client._Fullname
member.summary: The full name of the client

member.name: F:Toolbox.NETMF.NET.IRC_Client._Authenticated
member.summary: True when the user is authenticated by the remote server

member.name: F:Toolbox.NETMF.NET.IRC_Client._ServerName
member.summary: Contains the name of the IRC server

member.name: M:Toolbox.NETMF.NET.IRC_Client.#ctor(Toolbox.NETMF.NET.SimpleSocket,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.param: Password to connect to the server (optional)

member.name: M:Toolbox.NETMF.NET.IRC_Client._DataReceived(System.String)
member.summary: Triggered for every line of data received by the server

member.param: The recipient (may be a user or a channel)

member.param: The recipient (may be a user or a channel)

member.param: The recipient (may be a user or a channel)

Optional, the password(s) to join the channel(s)

member.param: The reason to leave the channel (optional)

member.summary: Sends raw data to the remote server

member.summary: Splits data according to the IRC protocol

member.returns: An array with 3 values: nickname, username, hostname

member.summary: True when the user is authenticated by the remote server

member.summary: Returns the name of the IRC server

member.summary: Event triggered when a message is received

member.summary: Event triggered when an action is received
